question: 一ヶ所
sourceMnemonic:
Remember the small ヶ acting as a counter? Together with <kanji>one</kanji> and <kanji>place</kanji>, it makes this <vocabulary>one place</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>one spot</vocabulary>.

Just like 〜ヶ月, you'll also run into this being written as 一箇所, 一か所, or 一カ所.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Just like before, the little ヶ is actually read as か. The rest uses the on'yomi you already learned with the kanji. Just watch out 一 here is いっ instead of いち as it makes it easier to pronounce the whole word. Now, read it aloud and try yourself!
